alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 5:36PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that the feeder band has moved out of the advisory area. However, more feeder bands should develop and move through the advisory area capable of producing another 1 to 2 inches of rainfall on top of the 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from the previous feeder bands. Therefore, the Flood Advisory will continue to remain in effect for Metro Palm Beach County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, West Palm Beach, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Wellington, Jupiter, Palm Beach Gardens, Lake Worth, Riviera Beach, Palm Beach, Tequesta, Highland Beach, Juno Beach, Ocean Ridge, Coconut Creek, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach and Parkland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
